reviews.review_msg: I would highly recommend this class if you are looking to boost your CGPA.

Paola is an amazing prof! She's really good at teaching the material, very kind and nice, gives amazing feedback, marks quite leniently even though the material can be a little difficult. Easy course to do well in, plus you'll learn a lot. 5/5, strongly recommend taking FREN 301W with her if possible
I have taken 4 classes with her and she is the best professor you'll ever have!! Huge sweetheart. Highly reccomend!!!

Paola is THE kindest professor I have ever met. She really does care about her students and is always available to help ! To be honest, I wish she was stricter with us. A lot of students started taking advantage of her kindness, coming in late on exam days and such, which wasn't cool. She'a disorganized at times, but it happens here and there.
shes super helpful! dont be afraid to reach out to her for help on your assigments because shes always super willing and helps with corrections you may not have even recognized to ask about

Paola is a gem of a prof. She truly cares about her students and their learning. As a student who struggles in French but loves it, I found her to be very kind. She gives clear feedback. Best part about her was that even though my grades were terrible, she supported me and recognized in the things I performed well in. 

I will take her class again.

Paola is a wonderful person! She's truly invested in your success and is more than willing to help before/after/outside class if available. Tests/assignments are graded fairly & feedback is helpful. If you do the practice stuff, study & ask questions you should be okay!

She is a phenomenal professor who has truly mastered teaching. Despite FREN222 covering lots of content I found to be difficult, Paola managed to make these topics seem simple, logical, and approachable. Her constant feedback and many practice problems helped me succeed on exams and writes. Exams were fair and were similar to practice problems.

The best professor I have had at SFU. She is so caring and is willing to help before or after class, or through email in addition to her office hours. She consistently provided me with additional preparation materials when I wanted some for exams. Her tests are fair and reflect what was seen in class and in exercises, and her marking is fair.

She cares about her student's success, providing us with many resources and extra practice! She was also always willing to stay after class (sometimes up to 30 minutes) with me, mind you this wasn't part of her office hours, going over assignments or concepts seen in class. Tests were quite challenging but if you prepare well, you will be fine!

Her kindness and smile is infectious. She really cares about people's success. She is willing to do office hours almost whenever throughout the week over Zoom or in-person. Class had a perfect grading scheme. I was always motivated to come to class to succeed as far as I could and I don't think I could have gotten an A- without her encouragement.
Paola is one of the professors I've ever had, I would take another class with her in a heart beat. She is wonderful.

Paola is worth every high rating she gets here. She's such a joyful woman and fantastic professor. Her tests were very fair. The class moves relatively quickly, and there isn't a ton of out of class work to do, which is nice. The course content is hard and can be confusing, but she makes it worthwhile.

I have taken a few classes with Paola now and I can say she is the best prof in the French dept. She genuinely cares about her students and wants to see us succeed. You have to go to class because participation matters a lot but it is worthwhile because she makes lectures engaging with group work and opportunities to practice before being graded.

She's probably the best prof in the French department. Puts together lectures really well, and is engaging, lots of socializing in class so u make lots of friends! But, she's a tough grader, and she expects you to know certain French rules that we wouldn't know already since French isn't our first language! Also, she can be sassy in her emails.

Paola is so amazing! She really cares about her students and will help in any way possible! Her tests were a little harder than expected at times but she's very organized and gives plenty of time for projects

Super helpful- you can tell she's really rooting for your success. Ask questions if you're not sure, do the practice she gives you and review, and you'll do great. Can be a little vague sometimes. Just ask questions!

Paola was a great prof, one of the best I've had at SFU so far. She explains topics very clearly, and the tests are very fair. Study a little bit, and they should be easy. I've also had her for FREN221 and FREN222, she is great all around. She adjusts course material if the class is struggling. Her assignments and feedback are clear.

Really helpful course for French beginners, get ready to practice in class a lot. Paola is definitely the best instructor I would recommend, a warm hearted professor with endless patience and understanding. And the tests and assignments are absolut reasonable, not too hard not too easy as long as you work on it.

This class was a good level for me coming out of French immersion. The content was useful to improve my grammar and writing although you do have to work for it. Paola is really nice, helpful, and good at explaining concepts. My favourite prof this semester!

Paola is a very kind and helpful professor. She is very patient and gives clear explanations. Although much of the course content was dry and moved at a slow pace, it was relatively easy; you do need to put effort into your work, though.

The best teacher i have had in my entire university experience. Such an understanding, caring and compassionate prof that makes you love the language. The class is very interesting because of her approach and is definitely one I would recommend. Also such a cute lady, will remind you of your mom. Everyone loves her.
Paola was an amazing kind and caring prof! Fair marker, excellent self-complied grammar courseware and always there for her students plus she has office hours almost everyday.
She is a very nice professor. Passionate and patient to all students. Always willing to help in the office hours. Overall a happy and easy course. Highly recommend !

Frankly, Paola is not a good teacher and does not give useful feedback. Her assignments are unclear and unfairly marked. This class gives the appearance of an easy class, there is little homework, the material in the lectures is simple, but the tests given are very difficult and do not always coordinate with the information given in class.

Nice, gentle. A lot of material in the course, but I didn't come out of it feeling a lot better in French. It's not too hard. Study for the tests, and proof read your compositions a lot before handing them in, you'll do fine.
She's amazing, loved attending all her classes!
Great instructor
I love Paola, she is one of the best teachers I've had at SFU. Like everyone else, I found her to be very kind, easy-going and helpful.

Paola is a great prof, she cares for her students and tries to make everyone get involved. She's got a great sense of humour and reminds me of a "French Hippy" - if you need help, or are going through a tough time - she's there for you, as long as you're speaking French of course! Overall, great prof and looking forward to taking her classes again.
She is very kind and humorous, and nice as a person. Sometimes confusing as a prof.
very kind and cooperative

Paola is the sweetest prof in the world. The class is not easy but she makes it so fun and exciting. The class reminded me of a high school class and you are able to make a lot of new friends. She even made us cake on the last day of classes! Love her to death
Seriously amazing proff!

Paola is lovely - she's very kind, friendly, and easygoing. She makes sure that everyone understands and is always very helpful. Material was presented clearly. Tests and assignments were straightforward, and her expectations and feedback were always extremely clear and fair. Great prof! I would take her classes again.

Paola's the nicest! She really wants you to succeed. She's very helpful and fair. She gets a bit tired when the class has trouble with her teaching, but she never makes you feel bad for asking a question. She's very sweet and a happy person.

She is very helpful. Very Very nice Lady. She takes the material at a good pace so you aren't lost or behind. I rarely did "recommended" (but not for marks) homework and I never felt behind in the class. Also I was never embarrassed to ask her anything. VERY APPROACHABLE!

She is so great! It was like being back in high school again. She is so sweet and actually cares about your mark and wants you to do well. She tries to help as much as possible. Her marking is not that hard and she tells you what will be on the tests. No surprises, which is nice.
She is so nice. It is just like being back in high school. I was not expecting a university French teacher to be so caring. She really tries to help!
She is amazing!!!!! understandable marker and very caring!if you are taking any french  courses with her, definitely TAKE HER!
She is very nice and willing to help students, she is my favorite prof of my whole life!

Definitely recommend her--she's extremely kind and caring, makes the material as understandable and interesting as possible, and is a very fair marker. I definitely learned a lot in her class--take French classes with her!
super nice and halpful! she is always understanding of certain cirumstances, if you miss a class she even emails you important things you missed. Very fair marker.
Great prof.  she tries to be as clear as possible.  very nice and helpful.
She was really nice and helpful. She tried really hard to make it as interesting as possible (given that the subject was adv french grammar!) one of the best profs i've had.
What a sweet person! She's got an infectious smile and is more than willing to help any student. She made French enjoyable and she made me want to learn more. Def recommend!
Really nice person

I really like her! She's nice, always willing to help, friendly, understanding, tries her best to teach. But it would have been much better if her english was better (esp for this intro 2 course). But overall I really enjoyed the course with her!

The great thing about Paola is that she understands that learning a foreign language is -hard-.  That's not to say it's an easy class or anything, just that she can understand where her students are coming from, and is always happy to help.
She is just the nicest person ever and will help you as much as necessary. We need more teacher like her, she is the best.
Paola is an awesome professor, very friendly, caring, and helpful. I recommend her wholeheartedly.

Paola is great! She speaks really slowly and clearly, which is good for anyone whose French isn't 100% and she really wants to help students. She even made crêpes for my class at the end of the semester! Super sweet.
her classes were a bit boring, but she's a friendly, nice and easy-going prof. she's helpful if you're having difficulties (finding ideas) when writing your papers. her marking was fair.
She is a very kind and compassionate teacher. Her classes are a little boring but she tries very hard. She is a good teacher, and a fair marker. She is very understanding. Good.
what a sweet sweet woman! she doesnt speak english very well and she marks pretty hard, but she trys very hard to help you understand.
Not too bad of a prof, but VERY hard in her marking... a little bit too hard, even for university.
